business.headline: World Bank sees India growth at 6.5% for FY26, 6.3% for FY27In its latest South Asia Development Update, the World Bank highlighted that South Asia's overall growth is expected to slow to 5.8% in 2026, down from 6.6% in 2025, with trade disruptions and emerging technologies, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), creating fresh uncertainties for the region.

Why the 50-30-20 budget rule doesn't work for everyone, explains expertThe popular 50-30-20 budgeting rule has guided millions of people for decades. But personal finance expert says it often overlooks individual goals and may leave you short of what you actually need.
Here's how much salary hike employees can expect in 2026According to Aon's Annual Salary Increase and Turnover Survey 2025-26 for India, employees can expect an average salary hike of 9% next year.

New airport drives up real estate prices in Navi MumbaiThe development has already pushed property prices in surrounding areas such as Panvel, Ulwe, and Kharghar, as investors and developers rush to capitalise on the opportunities the airport promises.

UPI to introduce facial and fingerprint authentication soon: ReportUPI is set to allow users to authenticate transactions using facial recognition and fingerprints, according to sources. This new feature is expected to go live soon.

Pension hike after 11 years? All-important EPFO meeting to decide soonAfter more than a decade, pensioners may finally get some relief. The EPFO is set to discuss raising the minimum pension under EPS-95 during its upcoming board meeting in Bengaluru on October 10–11.

LG Electronics IPO: GMP hints at strong listing, but is it really a good bet?Early signals from the market suggest strong demand. The Grey Market Premium, for instance, is reported at Rs 318, implying a potential listing price of around Rs 1,458 per share, roughly 28% above the upper end of the price band.
Gold prices hit another record high: Invest now or wait?With gold hitting new all-time highs, investors are asking: should I buy now, or wait for prices to stabilise?

Out of stock: How GST rate cuts have left companies scrambling for supplyLarge-screen televisions and premium mobile phones have gone out of stock in many parts of the country as manufacturers misjudged the post-GST demand surge.
Tata Capital IPO Day 2: Check GMP, subscription status and moreThe Tata Capital IPO is set to close on Wednesday, October 8, with allotment scheduled for October 9 and listing on October 13.

ITR processed but tax refund still pending? Here's what you should doMany taxpayers are finding themselves in a fix this year; their Income Tax Returns (ITRs) show "processed", but the refund hasn't reached their bank accounts yet. If you're one of them, here's what might be causing the delay and what you can do about it.

Is the auto sector rally over for now? Analysts bet on these sectors nextThe latest report from the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) shows historic sales during Navratri, backed by strong demand and the recent GST rationalisation. However, analysts believe that while the short-term growth looks impressive, the auto rally may soon stabilise as pent-up demand fades.

Sensex jumps 400 points: 3 factors behind today's rally on Dalal StreetMarket analysts pointed to a combination of factors driving the rally—upbeat Q2 updates from large-cap firms, an early pick-up in festive season spending, and improved GST collections reflecting resilient consumption.
Sensex opens 140 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Power Grid up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 215.94 points to 82,006.06, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 64.90 points to 25,142.55, as of 9:38 am.

LG Electronics IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band, and should you subscribe?The company has set a price band of Rs 1,080–Rs 1,140 per share for the offer, which comprises an offer for sale (OFS) worth Rs 11,600 crore, representing a 15% stake divestment by the South Korean parent, LG Electronics Inc.

LG Electronics IPO: The good, the bad, and what investors should knowIncorporated in 1997, LG Electronics India Ltd is one of the country's largest manufacturers and distributors of home appliances and consumer electronics.

Are Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities beating metros in job creation? Check hereThe strong growth in hiring in Tier-2 cities has been supported by expansion in e-commerce warehousing, retail networks, customer support hubs, and festive tourism demand.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG Electronics IPO: Which one should you bet onWhile Tata Capital marks one of the largest financial services IPOs in India, LG Electronics India's offer is among the biggest in the consumer electronics space.

Here's a step-by-step guide to checking and updating KYC for mutual fundsBefore investing in mutual funds, keeping your KYC up to date is essential. Here's a simple step-by-step guide to checking and updating your KYC details.

Government in talks with insurers for climate-linked insurance scheme: ReportIndia ranks among the most climate-exposed nations, and to address this, the government has started talks with insurers to build a nationwide climate-linked insurance plan.

entertainment.headline: KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan gets called Bhoot Uncle from junior contestant Purav Junior contestant Purav from Kolkata referred to Amitabh Bachchan as 'Bhoot Uncle' on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. Amitabh Bachchan responded to the playful exchange by referencing his film role in 'Bhootnath'.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 to be shut after pollution control board flags violation The Karnataka State Pollution Control Board has halted 'Bigg Boss Kannada 12' filming and ordered for its immediate closure after finding multiple environmental violations at the Bidadi studio site.

Triptii Dimri appreciates Deepika Padukone's work amid Spirit casting changes After 'Spirit' casting controversy, Triptii Dimri's quiet gesture of liking a post praising Deepika Padukone sparked a widespread discussion online.

Vice Principals star Kimberly Hebert Gregory dies at 52 Kimberly Hebert Gregory, best known for her role as Dr Belinda Brown in HBO's 'Vice Principals', has died at the age of 52, leaving behind a rich legacy in television, film, and theatre.

Rishab Shetty's wife shares emotional note on Kantara Chapter 1 with BTS pics Pragathi Rishab Shetty, wife of actor-director Rishab Shetty and costume designer for 'Kantara' and 'Kantara Chapter 1', shared a heartfelt note and shared some behin- the-scenes pictures from the sets of the recent blockbuster.

Why Salman Khan's soft spot for Amaal Mallik is making Bigg Boss 19 hard to watch Salman Khan's perceived bias towards Amaal Mallik during 'Bigg Boss 19' sparked widespread criticism. Fans question the fairness of the show's editing and hosting decisions.

Mahesh Bhatt reveals childhood assault and family stigma Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt recalled being assaulted as a child and verbally abused about his family background. The incident was shared during an appearance on 'The Pooja Bhatt Show'.

Why Taylor Swift kept her engagement out of Selena Gomez's wedding speech Singer Taylor Swift dispelled rumours about her speech at Selena Gomez's wedding. She confirmed only the Ed Sheeran Instagram engagement rumour was true, denying all others.

Phantom of the Opera star Ben Lewis dies at 46 after battle with cancer Ben Lewis, the renowned Australian-British musical theatre actor famed for his role as the Phantom, has died at 46 after battling bowel cancer.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 faces backlash over Mihir-Ram scene Viewers expressed outrage over Mihir being compared to Lord Ram in a festival sequence. Social media users highlighted the character's past actions and questioned the show's message.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9: Immanuel dominates as housemates ignore Nagarjuna's warning On October 6, 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' turned intense as Bigg Boss nominated every contestant for eviction. The immunity task tested strength, strategy, and alliances. Immanuel stood out, winning immunity while bonds and rivalries continued to drive the game.

Monster The Ed Gein story review: Disturbing, stylish and self indulgentRelease Date:Fri Oct 03, 2025 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story' review: Netflix's show dives into the life of America's most infamous killer with chilling performances by Charlie Hunnam and Laurie Metcalf. Check if Ryan Murphy's show is worth the hype.

Dwayne Johnson posts emotional note as The Smashing Machine takes lowest opening Actor Dwayne Johnson's sports drama 'The Smashing Machine' opened to a disappointing $6 million. The film struggled against Taylor Swift's surprise concert film release, raising questions about box office dynamics.

Naga Chaitanya talks about love, marriage, and life with wife Sobhita Dhulipala Naga Chaitanya opened up about his love story and married life with Sobhita Dhulipala on 'Jayammu Nischayammuraa'. He also shared how they met online and emphasised the importance of fights in a real relationship.
Bengaluru filmmaker Hemanth arrested for allegedly sexually harassing actor Bengaluru police have arrested filmmaker Hemanth following allegations of sexual harassment made by a female actor.

No Baahubali 3, but surprise awaits: Producer Shobu ahead of The Epic's release 'Baahubali 3' is not in the works, confirmed producer Shobu Yarlagadda. 'Baahubali - The Epic', a combined film of the two parts, will release in theatres on October 31.

Sunny Sanskari... box office Day 5: Kantara Hindi dominates Varun-Janhvi's film Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor's 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' saw a major Monday drop, collecting Rs 3 crore on Day 5 and taking its total to Rs 33 crore in India. Meanwhile, Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: A Legend Chapter-1' continues to dominate the Hindi box office with record-breaking numbers.

Actor John Woodvine of The Crown, An American Werewolf In London fame dies at 96 Olivier Award-winning British stage and screen actor John Woodvine, known for The Crown and An American Werewolf in London, has died at 96.

Pawan Singh on wife Jyoti's cheating claims: She wanted to contest elections Bhojpuri superstar Pawan Singh has responded to wife Jyoti Singh's cheating allegations, clarifying that she visited his home asking for help to contest elections. The actor also denied calling the police, saying they were present only to prevent any untoward incident.

general news.headline: No big brother, BJP and JDU likely to contest equal number of seats in BiharBihar assembly election dates were announced on Monday, with the state set to vote in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results on November 14. Over 7.4 crore voters, including first-time and female voters, will decide a high-stakes contest involving the NDA, Mahagathbandhan, and Jan Suraaj party.

I am with you: Vijay video calls each family affected due to Karur stampedeThe stampede, which occurred during Vijay's rally and claimed 41 lives, has caused ripples in Tamil Nadu's political circles ahead of the 2026 assembly polls.

Is Israel anywhere close to destroying Hamas, 2 years on?Two years after Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to "wipe out" Hamas following the October 7 massacre, the Gaza-based terror group remains battered but breathing. While US President Donald Trump has a Gaza peace plan, how close is Israel to fulfilling its vow of a total victory? And how has Hamas managed to stay alive?

Sanctioned mass rape of 400,000: India flips script as Pak rakes up KashmirDuring a debate on women and security at the United Nations, India tore into Pakistan over its continuing 'delusional tirades', particularly regarding Jammu and Kashmir.

Dealulu: Trump's Gaza plan is a suicide note disguised as a peace accordHamas, the only Palestinian party to the deal has to erase itself. The other, the Palestinian Authority, has to reform itself while Israel will decide when the IDF will vacate Gaza. In the grand tradition of diplomatic doodles, this is less a treaty and more a suicide pact wrapped in gold leaf. It is not ordained to fail, it's pure-ordained to fail.

Why motel business is getting Gujaratis killed in USThree Gujarati people linked to the motel business were killed last week in Pennsylvania and North Carolina in two separate incidents. In all, seven Gujarat-origin people have been killed in motel crimes across the US this year. Gujaratis own 60% of the motel business in the US. Why is the motel business so risky, and how are Gujaratis coming in harm's way?

INDIA bloc's Bihar seat-sharing talks hit as smaller allies seek bigger pieBihar elections: Mukesh Sahni, who rejoined the Grand Alliance ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha polls after ditching the NDA, demanded that he be declared the deputy chief ministerial face, sources said.

Video: Crocodile drags woman into river in Odisha, locals watch in horrorForest and fire service teams have launched a search operation, while officials have urged locals to stay away from the river amid reports of recurring crocodile sightings.

Accenture spent $2 billion in 3 years... to sack employees!Accenture has reduced its workforce by more than 11,000 employees in the past quarter, spending over $2 billion on severance in recent years as the company undertakes a major restructuring driven by automation and changing industry demands.

How the horrors of October 7 turned Gaza into 51 million tonnes of rubbleExactly two years ago, Hamas' brutal attack killed 1,200 Israelis, sparking Israel's devastating retaliation, reducing Gaza to over 50 million tonnes of rubble and leaving 67,000 Palestinians dead. Two years on, deaths, famine, displacement, and the promise of an elusive peace persist.

After bitter legal fight, Arvind Kejriwal scores sprawling government bungalowAfter repeated interventions by the Delhi High Court, central agencies eventually identified 95 Lodhi Estate for AAP chief and former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

One-third of Silicon Valley is Indian. That's not a flex, it's an escapeBragging that one-third of Silicon Valley tech workers are Indian is no longer impressive. With record placement failures at IITs and a decaying syllabus, it's time we stopped hiding behind diaspora success. Here are six reasons why we strongly believe so.

Is India's thali driving diabetes, obesity? What an ideal Indian plate should beA recent ICMR study highlights India's high carbohydrate consumption as a critical reason for the diabetes and obesity crisis.

Bengaluru woman claims auto driver tried to hit her after argument, shares videoA Bengaluru-based woman shared a video of an auto driver who refused to drop her at her destination and even attempted to hit her after an argument. The video has since gone viral on social media.

Tamil Nadu issues show-cause notice to Coldrif maker, seeks full production detailsTamil Nadu Drugs Control Department issued a show cause notice to Sresan Pharmaceuticals after 16 children died in MP and Rajasthan. Inspections found toxic chemicals, unhygienic conditions, and major lapses in Coldrif syrup production.

Mahesh Bhatt reveals childhood assault and family stigmaFilmmaker Mahesh Bhatt recalled being assaulted as a child and verbally abused about his family background. The incident was shared during an appearance on 'The Pooja Bhatt Show'.

I don't regret it, says lawyer suspended for shoe attack on Chief Justice GavaiSuspended senior Supreme Court lawyer Rakesh Kishore, 71, who tried to throw a shoe at Chief Justice BR Gavai said that he wasn't drunk and has "no regret" for his act.

Attack on CJI Gavai and its online celebration is violation of Sanatan DharmaThe attack on Chief Justice of India BR Gavai by advocate Rakesh Kishore, justified in the name of "Sanatan Dharma," exposes a grave misunderstanding of dharma, justice, and true religious respect.

'We now want to be drivers of the bus': Interview with Ashwini VaishnawAshwini Vaishnaw, Union Minister of Electronics and Information Technology, spoke to Group Editorial Director Raj Chengappa about the Modi government's vision for and execution of the massive Rs 76,000 crore India Semiconductor Mission (ISM). Excerpts:
Why the perfect parent image is just toxicTired of seeing parents on social media who seem to have it all together while you feel like you're barely keeping up? That's a toxic trap you need to ditch.

Break-ups have no rulebook, but Shobhaa De offers some suggestions all the sameAs provocative and frank as ever, Shobhaa De offers instructions such as "abandon good sense" when it comes to owning one's sensuality in her latest book.

America First doesn't mean America Alone: Netanyahu's pointed message to TrumpBenjamin Netanyahu, in a wide-ranging interview with Ben Shapiro, offered candid insights into his relationship with Donald Trump, Iran's threat, and the need to destroy Hamas.

Sabarimala gold loss row: Sponsor sought leftover gold for a wedding, email showsA court document revealed that a sponsor of Sabarimala's gold work requested leftover gold to fund a girl's marriage. The Travancore Devaswom Board responded after consulting temple officials following Dwarapalaka refixation.

sports.headline: Fabio Cannavaro named Uzbekistan coach for 2026 World Cup debut Italian World Cup-winning captain Fabio Cannavaro has been appointed as Uzbekistan's national football team head coach, guiding the Central Asian nation into their first-ever FIFA World Cup appearance in 2026. The move signals Uzbekistan's ambition to make a mark on the world stage, bolstered by key players and a globally experienced coaching staff.

Brooke Halliday gutted after NZ's loss to SA: We let Sophie Devine down Brooke Halliday admitted that New Zealand's heavy defeat to South Africa in the Women's World Cup 2025 was especially disappointing as the team failed to support their skipper Sophie Devine. It was only Devine who stood her ground against the Proteas, depsite being in a losing cause.

India's fastest meets the world's fastest: Kujur hangs out with Usain Bolt India's fastest man Animesh Kujur met his hero Usain Bolt in Mumbai. The duo met through a Puma collaboration after Animesh's breakthrough season in Indian athletics.

Without the captain's armband, will Rohit Sharma play differently in ODIs? With Shubman Gill now captain in ODIs, all eyes are on Rohit Sharma. Can he maintain the fearless tempo that defined his captaincy, and will the former skipper be given the freedom to continue the risk-laden approach that brought India success over the past two years?

Women's World Cup: Vizag pitch set to aid struggling India batters A balanced and batting-friendly pitch awaits India's women's cricket team at Vizag. This is expected to boost the confidence of the batters ahead of their matches against South Africa and Australia.

Smriti Mandhana's idea becomes reality: Mithali Raj stand at Vizag stadium The ACA-VDCA Stadium in Visakhapatnam will honour Mithali Raj and Ravi Kalpana by naming stands after them, acknowledging their impact on Indian women's cricket, after a public suggestion by Smriti Mandhana that received backing from Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh.

Rishabh Pant eager to make Ranji Trophy comeback after injury break: Report Injured Rishabh Pant is eager to make his comeback in red ball cricket. If reports are to be believed, then the wicketkeeper-batter wants to make his return in the Ranji Trophy.

Dravid saw it early: When ex-coach backed Shubman Gill for full-time captaincy Entrusted with the reins in two of the three international formats, Shubman Gill's ascent to leadership has unfolded under Gautam Gambhir's watch. Yet, it was Rahul Dravid who first sensed the spark in him as early as 2020–21.

From outcast to leader: New ODI VC Shreyas Iyer finally gets recognition Shreyas Iyer has finally received the recognition he deserves, as the 30-year-old has been named the new vice-captain of the Indian ODI team. Never one to seek the spotlight, Shreyas has quietly gone about his work, letting his performances speak for themselves.

Maxwell, Cummins out as Australia announce ODI squad for India series Australia have announced their 15-member squad for the 3-match ODI series against India. Glenn Maxwell and Pat Cummins have not made it to the team due to respective injuries.

Sanju Samson's selection saga: Talent, versatility on display yet chances go missingDespite a century in his last ODI and strong Asia Cup performances, Sanju Samson remains sidelined from the ODI side. His selection saga raises tough questions about consistency, faith, and the logic behind India's ever-changing plans.

World Cup is the biggest stage for Bangladesh to show talent: Nigar SultanaNigar Sultana feels that the Women's World Cup 2025 is the biggest stage for Bangladesh to show their talent and get big teams to play against them in the coming years. Bangladesh won their first match in the tournament.

We'll look to negate in-form Marufa Akter's swing early on: Charlie DeanEngland's vice-captain admitted that they will be looking to tackle Bangladesh's Marufa Akter's swing early on in their upcoming clash in the Women's World Cup.

Having Nat Sciver-Brunt, Charlotte Edwards feels like a fresh start: Charlie DeanEngland vice-captain Charlie Dean says having Natalie Sciver-Brunt as captain and Charlotte Edwards as coach has brought a "fresh start" to the team, with renewed focus, clarity, and a shared determination to play fearless, detail-driven cricket.

Shaw to face Mumbai in Maharashtra practice match ahead of Ranji TrophyPrithvi Shaw will play against his former Mumbai teammates after moving to Maharashtra, as both teams prepare for the upcoming Ranji Trophy season with a practice match at MCA Stadium, Gahunje. Shardul Thakur leads a Shreyas Iyer-less Mumbai, with Ruturaj Gaikwad and Jalaj Saxena included in the Maharashtra squad.

Marufa Akter can become Bangladesh's greatest pacer ever: Nigar SultanaBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana feels that Marufa Akter can become the greatest pacer produced by the nation. Marufa was in fine form during the first match of the tournament against Pakistan.

Rahul Dravid's son, Anvay set to lead Karnataka in Vinoo Mankad TrophyLike father, like son — that seems to be the story in the Dravid household, as Anvay Dravid, son of legendary India batter Rahul Dravid, is set to lead Karnataka in the upcoming Vinoo Mankad Trophy.

Tazmin Brits' day in Indore: Breaking Lanning's record, celebration picked by fansSouth Africa Tazmin Brits reacted to breaking Meg Lanning's record and the reason behind her arrow celebration after the win over New Zealand. Brits scored 101 as the Proteas women recorded their first win of the Women's World Cup 2025 on Monday, October 6.

South Africa bounce back with resounding win as New Zealand's woes continueWomen's World Cup: South Africa have their first points on the board as they took a rather resounding win over New Zealand, riding on the back of brilliant performances by the centurion, Tazmin Britz and Nonkululeko Mlaba's four-wicket haul.

Where is the 2024 Ballon d'Or winner?Rodri's persistent injuries have kept him off the field, leaving fans and pundits wondering if and when he will return to the form that made him Europe's elite midfielder.

Gautam Gambhir to host Indian team for dinner ahead of Delhi Test vs West IndiesIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has invited the entire Indian squad and support staff for dinner ahead of the second Test in Delhi. This sets up as a good chance for the team to unwind ahead of a busy schedule.

Catch of the tournament? Laura Wolvaardt produces screamer in SA vs NZ clashLaura Wolvaardt produced the catch of the tournament as she took a one-handed stunner to dismiss Lea Tahuhu during the South Africa vs New Zealand clash in the Women's World Cup 2025.

Abhishek Sharma backed by AB de Villiers to thrive in Australian conditionsAB de Villiers believes that Abhishek Sharma can thrive in the Australian conditions as India prepare for their white-ball tour Down Under later this month.

Rohit Sharma non-committal about World Cup? Expect more bad news then, says GavaskarSunil Gavaskar sent a warning to Rohit Sharma and told him to expect more bad news if he remains non-committal about his participation in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Rohit was removed as the captain of the Indian ODI team on October 4.

No Virat Kohli or Rohit Sharma, but IND vs AUS 2nd T20I at MCG sells out anywayPublic tickets for the second T20I between India and Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground were sold out more than three weeks before the fixture, underlining the enduring appeal of the contest even without superstars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
